items.content:
* NO AGENCIES OR RECRUITERS PLEASE *

Wildfish - https://wildfish.com

We're a London based consultancy who work mainly with Django.

We're looking for a full stack developer to join us, ideally permanently but will consider freelance too. Primarily you'll be working on our client sites maintaining and developing Django web applications and mobile APIs, but also working on some of our own products and open source projects (https://github.com/wildfish/).

Everyone in our organisation is technical, all of us working remotely, although it's handy if you're within distance of London for meetings occasionally. We're ideally looking for someone in the UK, but will possibly consider someone overseas with excellent English in a similar timezone.Some of the things we use, which it would be good for you to know some of:

- Python/Django [Essential]

- HTML/CSS/Javascript [Essential]

- Twitter Bootstrap

- React / React Native

- PostgreSQL

- Ubuntu Linux Server Admin

- Docker

- AWS, GCE, Kubernetes

The most important thing is that you must be passionate about your craft, and eager to share and learn with others who feel the same.You'll need to be able to work autonomously, so it's important that you're the sort of person who has attention to detail and can be self motivated.

Please email work@wildfish.com, including the salary or rate you're looking for, along with a list of 3 Django apps you like to use in projects, and a link to any code you have available online. Please also mention if you have any interest in cryptocurrency.

Thanks :)

Work within a team and execute full NetSuite implementations.

Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change at ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

Oslo, Remote · Cofounder
The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.Read More

The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.

We believe that the core problem of global warming is lack of global collaboration. Our goal is to support and enhance global collaboration facilitated by an ecosystem of carefully crafted software systems. Just like Wikipedia is a computer facilitated collaboration platform around building the world’s biggest encyclopedia – so will ACT enable collaboration around green shopping and help humans ACT together for a sustainable planet so that we can do our part to end global warming and also support fair trade.

We have just finished a major design phase and now wish to start serious development of the software platform. We are looking to tell the world about our extraordinary solution for ACTion, that we believe will change the way we manage global climate change almost overnight.

We need to strengthen our team, our advisory board and council with experienced resources within multiple fields: Management, Communication/journalism/marketing, Financial management, Fundraising, Life cycle analysis & research, Graphical design, Web development, Mobile development, Backend development, Networking.

WHY ACT?
Have you ever thought that it is impossible to solve global climate change and that your effort would mean so little?

What if you had the chance to work with one of the most ambitious climate change projects? We believe that ACT is one of the most hands-on solutions to mitigating climate change. These might sound like just 'great words,' but do the math yourself: E.g. If only 1700 people decided to use ACT to find the least fossil fuel consuming goods, service alternatives and register their purchases it would deliver a combined purchasing power of 63 million USD/year after tax*, which is the same amount Norway uses to conserve the Amazonas rainforest! And those 1700 people could decide to ACT tomorrow!

* Assuming a salary of 37,000 USD/year after tax.

Applied
Apply to ACT Cooperative Corporation AS
Add a message to ACT Cooperative Corporation AS
Apply

Job Description

ABOUT ACT
ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking an iOS developer to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking fundraisers to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

We believe that the core problem of global warming is lack of global collaboration. Our goal is to support and enhance global collaboration facilitated by an ecosystem of carefully crafted software systems. Just like Wikipedia is a computer facilitated collaboration platform around building the world’s biggest encyclopedia – so will ACT enable collaboration around green shopping and help humans ACT together for a sustainable planet so that we can do our part to end global warming and also support fair trade.

- ACT is software technology with smart gamification to connect consumers around sustainable shopping and collaboration.
- The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.
- ACT is a role model of a democratic organization: Max factor of 8 between highest and lowest paid, all employees has 1 vote, no person or organization can own voting shares (i.e. no external organization can control ACT, which is important to keep us a partner of independent advice).
- All software is expected to be open source and free, so that all can take action.

We have just finished a major design phase and now wish to start serious development of the software platform. We are looking to tell the world about our extraordinary solution for ACTion, that we believe will change the way we manage global climate change almost overnight.

We need to strengthen our team, our advisory board and council with experienced resources within multiple fields: Management, Communication/journalism/marketing, Financial management, Fundraising, Life cycle analysis & research, Graphical design, Web development, Mobile development, Backend development, Networking.

WHY ACT?
Have you ever thought that it is impossible to solve global climate change and that your effort would mean so little?

What if you had the chance to work with one of the most ambitious climate change projects? We believe that ACT is one of the most hands-on solutions to mitigating climate change. These might sound like just 'great words,' but do the math yourself: E.g. If only 1700 people decided to use ACT to find the least fossil fuel consuming goods, service alternatives and register their purchases it would deliver a combined purchasing power of 63 million USD/year after tax*, which is the same amount Norway uses to conserve the Amazonas rainforest! And those 1700 people could decide to ACT tomorrow!

* Assuming a salary of 37,000 USD/year after tax.

JOB DESCRIPTION, FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS
ACT is now selling shares and applying for funding with various organizations. We need 2 highly motivated FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS to join our Core team in this exciting phase that will have a serious impact on sustainability of our planet.

At best the following requirements apply to you:

- You have applied and won support from Innovasjon Norge on multiple occasions.
- You have applied and won support from various other foundations.
- You have experience from selling shares.
- You have a good network.
- You have a good command of English.

The fundraisers will work closely with co-founders and be a part of our small team of entrepreneurs with a flat organizational structure. Since the company is in an early phase you will be able to shape your role in the company exactly how you like it best.

WORK PLACE
This job should at best be carried out as much as possible in co-location with ACT in Oslo, but we are open to remote work too.

APPLICATION
Please send your CV and some words introducing yourself, why you want to work with ACT, highlight relevant previous experience and your current situation.

For more information about this job and ACT please contact:

Thomas Jepsen
President, Founder & CTO

items.title: Aha!: Senior Legal Counsel (in-house SaaS exp. required)
items.content:
Senior Legal Counsel (in-house SaaS exp. required)

Company: Aha!
Headquarters: Remote
https://www.aha.io/
Are you an attorney who wants to work remotely for one of the fastest-growing software companies? Do you have a passion for law, technology, and business?

Now, imagine this — you get to work directly with a proven team that is changing how the world’s best-known companies innovate and build products — all from your home office. And you are the go-to legal resource — because you are the first full-time attorney at Aha!

That sounds interesting, right? We are building a very different kind of company. We have no venture funding, no office, and no salespeople. We run the business differently. We serve thousands of enterprises and create tons of value for them and the team every day. And we do it in a people-first, structured way.

We are looking for a business-minded corporate attorney who is ready to take a huge career leap forward. If this is you, we want to hear from you!

As Senior Corporate Counsel, you will have an excellent opportunity to join a breakthrough and profitable company that is growing fast. Aha! was founded by a proven team of Silicon Valley veterans whose last two businesses were acquired by well-known public companies. More than 200,000 users trust Aha! to link their brilliant strategy to their team's work and create visual roadmaps.

We are looking for someone who:
  • Has a JD degree from a top law school
  • Is a licensed attorney in good standing in the state where they are located
  • Has worked for a large law firm for 3+ years
  • Has worked in-house at a technology company for 3+ years
  • Is experienced in contract law and working directly with customers, especially in a SaaS setting
  • Is comfortable working in multiple legal disciplines (e.g. contracts, regulatory, privacy, employment) at the same time
  • Seeks harmony between pursuing growth and managing risk
  • Writes exceptionally well
  • Says “yes” and “no” with kindness
We are committed to being great, and we want someone who:
  • Understands what the last S in SaaS stands for
  • Wants to be the first in-house attorney at Aha! and work on all legal-related matters
  • Has a "can do" attitude and a history of delivering superb work again and again
  • Can work at a fast-paced company where the feedback cycle is measured in hours rather than weeks
  • Is seeking a career-defining opportunity on a proven, results-oriented team that has sold multiple software companies

We are building a distributed team, and you can work from anywhere in the United States for this role. We offer generous salary, equity, benefits, and a profit-sharing program.

For immediate consideration, please follow these helpful guidelines and contact us at Operations-jobs@aha.io. If you have the right background, we will quickly follow up with you. We are not working with recruiters or third-party agencies.

Apply for this position

At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. The way we interact with email has evolved somewhat in the last 20 years, but calendars are stuck in the 90s. The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner.

The main reason for which we plan our day is because time is the most important commodity in the world. Calendars today are good for recording our daily agenda, but they are terrible at coordinating time with others. We’re focusing on coordinating daily life because that’s where tons of value can be added. Join us!

Applied

What We're Building

Calendar usage grew tremendously in the past few years fueled by adoption of cloud services and mobile devices. Unfortunately, appointments are spread across many services and we are still wasting a lot of time in back-and-forth emails or phone calls. It's often impossible to share real-time availability with others because Outlook and Google Calendar don't work cross-company.

FreeBusy is a scheduling assistant powered by A.I. to coordinate meetings 10x faster with contacts inside and outside your company. You can interact with FreeBusy on the web, smartphone, and desktop, using voice, chat, and email. FreeBusy
works with existing calendars (Google, Office 365, Exchange, iCloud, Outlook.com, etc.) and you can link as many as you have (work, personal, school). Easily share unified availability with business contacts whether they use FreeBusy or not.

Our current focus is to increase enterprise agility when scheduling meetings cross-company. Watch our story https://youtu.be/HobWYI-QYQM

items.content:
Senior Consultant SAP-Entwicklung (w/m)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Business Process Optmization, Information Technology, Platforms
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Ceyoniq Technology GmbH | Bielefeld, Deutschland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin
Office Location: Bielefeld, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

sap
abap
hana

Job description

Ihre Aufgaben

  • Sie übernehmen die Entwicklung und Fachberatung auf Kundenanforderungen.
  • Sie sind betraut mit der IT- und fachkonzeptionellen Beratung mit anschließender Umsetzung.
  • Sie bereiten Kundenworkshops vor und führen diese eigenverantwortlich durch.
  • Ihnen obliegt die Beratung und Entwicklung mit zukunftsorientierten (Entwicklungs-) Technologien.

Ihre Qualifikation

  • Sie haben ein Studium (Uni, FH o.ä.) im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik mit mindestens „GUT“ oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung/Qualifikation erfolgreich abgeschlossen.
  • Sie verfügen über mindestens 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als SAP-Entwickler.
  • Sie können auf umfangreiche energiewirtschaftliche Branchenkenntnisse zurückgreifen.
  • Sie besitzen exzellente Kenntnisse in ABAP, ABAP OO, SAP Workflow, SAP Reporting.
  • Sie können auf sehr gute SAP-Kenntnisse in SAP IS-U, FI-CA, SAP PM, SAP HANA zurückgreifen.
  • Sie sind sicher im Umgang mit dem MS Office Paket.
  • Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Ihr Profil ab.

Ihr Profil

  • Sie verfügen über ein ausgewogenes kundenorientiertes/unternehmerisches Denken mit einem beständigen Maß an Dienstleistungsorientierung.
  • Sie überzeugen durch Ihr sicheres Auftreten, Ihre ausgezeichneten Umgangsformen sowie Ihre Vertrauenswürdigkeit, Zuverlässigkeit und Zielstrebigkeit.
  • Sie beherrschen die Kombination aus Einfühlungs- und Durchsetzungsvermögen.
  • Sie zeichnen sich durch analytisches, selbständiges und systematisches Arbeiten mit einem hohen Qualitätsbewusstsein und beständigem Maß an Kundenorientierung aus.
  • Sie verfügen über Teamgeist und Integrationsbereitschaft.
  • Sie bringen die Bereitschaft mit, viel zu reisen.

Ihre Perspektiven

  • Sie partizipieren bei der Einarbeitung durch ein gelebtes Mentorenprinzip.
  • Es erwarten Sie flache Hierarchien sowie ein sehr gutes Arbeitsklima, geprägt durch ein offenes, kooperatives und faires Miteinander.
  • Wir bieten Ihnen individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten zum Auf- und Ausbau der eigenen Skills.
  • Wir bieten einen Arbeitsplatz mit einer erstklassigen, technischen Ausstattung in einem innovativen, dynamischen Unternehmen und einem zukunftsorientierten Branchenumfeld.
  • Mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten ermöglichen wir eine ausgewogene Work-Life-Balance.
Apply now

Benefits

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten
  • Gute Anbindung
  • kostenloses Obst, Wasser und Kaffee
  • Coole Typen
  • Individuelle Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
  • erstklassige technische Ausstattung
  • Work-Life-Balance

items.title: Business Intelligence Developer / Consultant (Living in Toronto only) at Iridium Technology (Toronto, ON, Canada)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=11, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=27}
items.content:
Business Intelligence Developer / Consultant (Living in Toronto only)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Business Intelligence, Legal, Legal Technology
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Iridium Technology | Toronto, ON, Canada

Remote details

Office Location: Toronto, ON, Canada. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

c#
tsql
html5
angularjs
mdx

Job description

We currently have a development team in Toronto and we are looking to expand.  The "remote" aspect is that we currently have employees working from home offices and meeting up in work-spaces in Reno several times per week.  This position is only open to Canadians living in Toronto.

T-SQL is one of our core technologies, and is a required skill. If you are not solid on T-SQL, please do not apply.  Our programming test for all applicants is based on T-SQL through SSMS.

The position of BI Consultant/Developer requires candidates with very strong development skills. This is a client-facing role, so excellent communication skills are also a must. We are looking for applicants who are entrepreneurial, incredibly bright, organized, focused, creative problem solvers, able to work independently, extremely hard-working, and who embrace the home office-based lifestyle.

Salary

Salary is set depending on your experience. If you can pass our application process we will be able to agree on a salary that works for you. 

Job Responsibilities

The role encompasses a combination of consulting and development duties, including: 

  • Client-facing resource: work directly with our law firm clients to implement and support Iridium BI products 
  • Report/dashboard design and development 
  • Manage client product implementations and projects to successful outcomes 
  • Requirements gathering, both for development projects and consulting/implementation projects 
  • Design, code, deploy, and test client-specific customizations and enhancements 
  • Design, code, deploy, and test Iridium BI product features and enhancements 
  • Development of software tools for internal use 
  • Technical investigations 
  • Client support/training  

Required Skills

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar 
  • Strong development skills and experience. Our technologies are SQL Server (relational database, T-SQL, SSAS, SSRS), HTML5, Angular JS, C# and others. While we prefer experience with these technologies, we will consider developers that are familiar with other technologies - our thinking is that hard-core coders can learn any technology stack. 
  • Excellent written/oral communications skills 
  • We develop software for law firms. Experience in Legal IT (ADERANT, Elite Enterprise, Elite 3E) is a big plus, but is not required 
Apply now

About Iridium Technology

Does this get you excited? 
Living in Toronto, getting a great salary, flexible hours, and our unlimited vacation policy.  And more importantly, no commute and no parking problems, because a lot of your time will be spent working out of your home office!  Note that you will be expected to meet up with your team multiple times per week, and at some point this year we will probably get an office in downtown Toronto.


Note that if you don't want to work from a home office, we will cover the cost of membership in a co-working environment.

Work Environment

Iridium provides a great environment for developers to learn new technologies and show off their skills.  First of all, this is a company that is run by developers. 25 out of our 30 employees have degrees in Computer Science or IT.  We love to code, design architectures, streamline processes, and are relentlessly striving for constant improvement.  We have modern/relevant technology stack, and we are moving aggressively into implementing the Microsoft Azure BI/AI capabilities.  Each developer is assigned to a team with 4-5 members, and collaborative programming and collaborative problem-solving are highly encouraged. You will constantly be challenged to learn new technologies and extend your knowledge of Iridium’s products.  We offer a very agile and empowered environment – if you have a great idea, speak up and present it to the team. If the team loves your idea, then we will look for you to implement it. 

Iridium is an 8-year old company that thinks it is still a startup.  What is nice is that we have the startup attitude, but also offer stable and long-term employment with a company that has positive cash flow and is not concerned about running out of money.  We offer the start-up mindset, but without the fear that we will close our doors next month. 

If you are looking for a relaxing job where you can work 8-5 Monday through Friday, then this is not the job for you. The Iridium work experience is fast-paced and high intensity. You will be a member of a team of extremely talented and highly skilled technical employees. We all bring our “whatever it takes attitude” to solving both technical and client issues. You will be empowered to showcase your technical skills and grit on a daily basis. You will be given massive responsibility and be expected to independently manage yourself. We can promise overtime, late nights, and even some weekend work. But we can also promise a great sense of achievement, and a supportive team environment that makes it all worthwhile. Are you a hard-charger? If so, you will fit right in and you will love working here.

Benefits

  • Great salary
  • Work from your home office
  • UNLIMITED vacation policy
  • Flexible hours
  • Will invest into your development
  • New laptop

items.content:
Etcher.io Open-source Maintainer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Resin.io | No office location

Technologies

node.js
electron
open-source
embedded-linux

Job description

On being a Open Source Maintainer at Resin.io

Etcher is one of the most popular open source Electron applications in the world, with millions of users provisioning SD Cards and USB sticks.

We envision Etcher as a core part of the IoT provisioning and development workflow. Etcher will be able to connect to devices, configure them, and even flash various board and microprocessors. Etcher Pro, a stand-alone hardware version of Etcher, is meant to disrupt the drive duplicator industry.

We’re looking for a passionate entrepreneurial-minded software engineer to lead Etcher, cooperate with the rest of the product team, and keep growing its community, while assisting the core mission of resin.io, to reduce friction for device fleet owners.

Responsibilities 

  • Actively invest back in our own technology, libraries, and frameworks
  • Understand security best practices and strive to apply them in your work
  • Be highly motivated to produce great code
  • Evaluate customer requirements and other inputs to determine the scope and timing of new functionality
  • Lead and grow Etcher's open source community
  • Define the Etcher vision and make it a reality
  • Coordinate the work of the Etcher team

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You'd be bothered by an inefficient process
  • Good understanding of software engineering practices and how to apply them
  • Excellent written communication skills, and fluency in English
  • Self-discipline to take on a project and push it to completion without too much management. You also know when to ask for help
  • Strong problem-solving abilities. You know how to split a complex problem into incremental pieces
  • Experience leading, or contributing to, open source projects
  • Experience with cross-platform development
  • Experience with Electron and Node.js

Nice to have:

  • A sample of your work (URL or attached sample)
  • Contributions to OSS projects (please include a URL)
  • Having worked remotely before
  • Experience with Resin.io as a user
  • Experience with embedded GNU/Linux, anything ranging from personal projects with a Raspberry Pi to commercial or industrial scenarios with custom devices
  • Experience growing a technology business

Make sure to let us know if any of these items apply to you!

Apply now

About Resin.io

Resin.io provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage the code that runs on connected devices. In short, we make IoT work.

Our technology is open, standards-based and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.title: Bookkeeper
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Bookkeeper at Fix My Cash Flow

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Fix My Cash Flow (FMCF) is looking for someone who can help our growing organization with QuickBooks Online bookkeeping and cash flow management. FMCF is committed to maintaining a business that is inclusive and where all employees respect the other humans we do business with regardless of their race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability unrelated to job requirements, genetic information, military service, or other protected status.

You must have experience using QuickBooks Online and creating complex spreadsheets with Microsoft Excel. Accuracy is paramount. Some of the applications we use on a regular basis include Google Apps (Sheets, Calendar, Docs, Drive, Chrome) Asana, Boomerang, Dropbox, and Grammarly.

The ideal candidate will have a desire to continually learn new skills as well as have a friendly, slightly outgoing personality. This is a positive and energetic business. You’ll work virtually with other team members via email, video conferencing, and screen-sharing.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Review, modify, and update vendor contracts.
  • Review, approve, and pay vendor bills via Bill.com
  • Ensure vendors provide their W-9 prior to issuing their first payment.
  • Organize documents in Dropbox.com or other online cloud storage system.
  • Comply with vendor bill payment policies and procedures and update as necessary.
  • Prepare weekly Unpaid Vendor Bills report.
  • Ensure timely completion of employee expense reports submitted via Expensify.
  • Record upcoming cash outflows on Bill.com Cash Forecast.
  • Prepare 1099s at year-end.
  • Review customer invoices prepared by the accounts receivable specialist.
  • Review and update customer agreements prepared by accounts receivable specialist.
  • Reconcile bank and credit card accounts in QBO.
  • Record adjusting journal entries in QBO as needed.
  • Assist with the month-end closing process.
  • Onboard new employees with Gusto as needed.
  • Register company to do business in various states on an as-needed basis.
  • Monitor checking account balance to ensure the business has the funds to pay its bills for at least 30 days.
  • Prepare weekly and monthly reporting package.
  • Document processes and procedures.
  • Identify inefficiencies in financial practices and recommend improvements.

Must Haves:

  • Fluent North American English-speaking skills. (Seriously . . . this is non-negotiable.)
  • Dedicated home office with computer, high-speed internet access, desk, chair, printer, scanner, and smartphone.
  • Willing and able to quickly respond to requests, such as reviewing (or preparing) a customer invoice within one business day.
  • Care about putting forth high-quality work., organizing work product, writing in complete sentences, using punctuation, proofreading emails, and double-checking work for accuracy and completeness.
  • Experience working in a virtual environment and using cloud-based applications.
  • Communicate in a friendly, personal but professional way. Go ahead, use a well-known colloquialism.
  • Err on the side of over-communicating rather than under-communicatingthe more updates and detail you can provide, the better.
  • Handle mistakes gracefully. Then, propose a process to prevent the same mistake from happening again.
  • Take ownership of tasks and responsibilities.
  • Be proactive about finding better, more efficient ways of doing things.
  • Ability to maintain a pleasant personality under stress.
  • Must be a self-starter who can handle a heavy volume of work and be able to handle multiple tasks at the same time.
  • Flexible and adaptable to change.
  • Ability to follow written instructions and offer recommendations for improvement.
  • Exceptional organizational skills.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
  • Willingness to undergo a 50-state criminal background check.

Software Skills

Nice-to-Haves

  • Asana
  • Bill.com
  • Dropbox
  • Expensify
  • Gmail
  • Google Apps: Drive, Sheets, Chrome, and Docs
  • Harvest
  • LastPass

Education + Experience

  • At least seven (7) years of experience working as a bookkeeper.
  • Understanding of some of the above-listed software applications or a fast ability to learn.
  • Two-year community college business degree with bookkeeping or accounting courses (preferred but not required).
  • Experience handling customer invoice collections from Fortune 1000 companies (preferred but not required).

Hours:

  • 10 to 15 Hours per week, depending on work volume.
  • Monday to Friday between 9:00 am to 5:00 pm ET. (There’s some room for flexibility if you live in a different time zone.)

Compensation:

  • $40 to $50 per hour depending on experience and qualifications.
  • This is a 1099 contractor position.

To apply:

Complete form below to apply. Please complete the application ASAP. Speed and fast action-taking are rewarded at FMCF.

Apply for job

items.title: Frontend Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (full time)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=26, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=40}
items.content:
Frontend Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (full time)

Company: Unhaggle Inc.

Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.

We are looking for Senior Front-end Developers with experience in web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world.

We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio, Solr and Redis.
Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.

You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas:

* Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brands
* Our web portal unhaggle.com
* Several web products we built for Enterprise clients.
* Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.
* We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following industry standards and good software development practices.

Requirements:

* At least 3 years of Javascript professional experience.
* Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascript well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks is a big plus
* Proficient and hands on experience with responsive web sites, including the Bootstrap library.
* You care about writing semantic well formed code and paying attention to standards and good practices.
* Experience using version control software, Git is a plus.
* Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based.
* Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review.
* Any previous experience with Django or Django templates is a big plus.

Bonus:

* Some experience with Linux is a big plus. You will be asked to deploy changes to our dev machines that are based in Linux (Ubuntu server). 
* Some experience with Python and/or experience with Django would be a big plus.

We are helping consumers to get the best price on new cars in Canada and changing the industry along the way. Working at Unhaggle brings unique challenges, you will have the opportunity to leave a large footprint and have real impact in the product we ship every day to our customers.

No relocation available, we are a distributed team.

How to apply:
Please submit resume and cover letter to evandro@unhaggle.com

items.content:
Go to our website to find more information about:
* How to apply (YOU CAN ONLY OFFICIALLY APPLY THERE - LOOK FOR THE PAGE "OPEN POSITIONS")
* Why join us
* Our general requirements

You looked at our open positions, you meet the listed general requirements, and maybe you did not find the role you are passionate about. At Founder8, we foresee vast growth ahead and chances are, we might be looking for a person just like you in the near future. If you feel you can add value to our team and your role is not described in our open positions, we encourage you to apply. It could be a unique opportunity for you to gain varied working experience at a fast-growing online startup, alongside a passionate, dynamic and welcoming international team. Please be specific and thorough in your application about why you are applying and why we should consider you.

We are looking for a high-performance team player-Is this You?
* Experience in a field that is relevant for Founder8 for example with founder networks and accelerators and/or innovative industries such as RetailTech, HealthTech, EnergyTech, TransportationTech and beyond.
* Expertise that could accelerate the achievement of our vision.

We would love if you have the following too
Experience with startup and scaleup founders, mentors, sponsors and/or investors.

YOU CAN ONLY OFFICIALLY APPLY ON OUR WEBSITE - LOOK FOR THE PAGE "OPEN POSITIONS" AND FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS THERE. THANK YOU.

Growth Hacker at Shortfundly

Chennai, Remote · Internship
Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.Read More

Shortfundly is an online media company that curates and shares the best short films and stories from india through our global multi-platform network. Our video and editorial platform enables a global audience to easily discover, watch and share unique stories from india anywhere on their desktop and mobile devices.

Our vision is to continually grow the community of short film audience to enable a wide and accessible market reach for short films and become the leading micro-cinema/shortfilm platform for india.

Applied
Apply to Shortfundly
Add a message to Shortfundly
Apply

Job Description

Shortfundly would be place for you, if you love the following in any particular order:

a. Movies
c. Startup culture

Shortfundly.com is creating a digital revolution in Shortfilm Industry.
we are looking for people who is passionate about entrepreneurship, marketing, psychology, startups, the future of technology, and building their own personal brand.

This is a mid level position in focusing on user adoption, entrepreneurship, and technology marketing. These skills will serve any aspiring entrepreneur as well as anyone who wants to help others fulfill their small business dreams. We'll be teaching you most of the things that you'll need to know as our strategies are unique and industry leading, so come with a thirsty mind and a hunger for helping create the future of tech.

Requirements:
-A passion for learning and an insatiable curiosity.
-Drive traffic in order to help reach exponential growth targets
-Conversion Optimisation
-Decisions based on data and A/B testing new features and ideas
-Cross-functional role – part of the product management team and work closely with marketing and engineering
-Working across the acquisition stack (SEM, SEO, offline conversions)
-Know how to use all common social media channels.
-Blogging, journalism, PR, photography or a creative writing background preferred.
-An interest in emerging technology.
-Ability to articulate with meaning and intention.
-Have an eye for aesthetics and good design.
-Strong research skills and the patience to discover the best that you can.
-High EQ, empathetic & a sense of humor.
-Creative & analytical thinker, we're a community of "why not?" thinkers.
-Grit, patience & resourcefulness.

Nice To Haves:
-Know your way around Photoshop, AfterEffects and InDesign.
-Have experience with additional analytics and marketing automation platforms: hootsuite, hubspot, aweber, google analytics, moz, etc.

Hours will be either part or full-time depending on what you can commit.

FairClaims Arbitrator at FairClaims

Los Angeles, Remote · Contract
FairClaims is the most efficient, most cost effective online dispute resolution platform for enterprise. We work with several leading online marketplaces to resolve their toughest small claims disputes using online video arbitration, mediated chat, smart settlement engine tools and more. And are vc backed (Greycroft Partners, Fika Ventures, Crosslink Capital) with plenty of runway.Read More

FairClaims is the most efficient, most cost effective online dispute resolution platform for enterprise. We work with several leading online marketplaces to resolve their toughest small claims disputes using online video arbitration, mediated chat, smart settlement engine tools and more. And are vc backed (Greycroft Partners, Fika Ventures, Crosslink Capital) with plenty of runway.

Brian Liu, one of the founders of legalzoom is an investor and champion. Along with other top industry angels and great vcs. We have a strong well defined vision, impressive traction and momentum, and are growing fast. Not to mention - we're making the world a better place by resolving more of the world's unresolved disputes. So let's talk about getting you on board.

Applied
Apply to FairClaims
Add a message to FairClaims
Apply

Job Description

We’re looking for contract arbitrators to join our growing group!

Ideal profile = experienced attorney who also has credentials, i.e. top law school, successful practice, business experience, big name law firm, or other distinctions.

Maybe you’re a stay at home parent who wants an interesting side project and extra income. Maybe you’re starting your own practice or business and looking for contract work. Maybe you want to get judicial/arbitration experience. Or just plain think this might be fun.

We pay $80/hour and expect each claim to take between 60-120 minutes of work.

Also note: you don’t need to have a license or certification to be an arbitrator.

Job Description

Help us bring Forkable to the world! Being a city launcher is like being a serial entrepreneur. You need to be very versatile, with lots of grit, attention to detail, initiative, and resourcefulness. And you should definitely like to travel!

What We're Building

Forkable is using AI to conquer the 834B global lunch market. It figures out what you want for lunch before you know it, automatically delivering the best local restaurants to your whole office. A unique copay system makes Forkable accessible to companies with a wide variety of budgets.

By solving the group ordering problem we are able to source from a wide variety of local restaurants with 20x lower delivery costs than normal.

Entrepreneur in Residence at dahmakan (YC S17)

Malaysia, Remote · Internship

Backed by Y Combinator and leading tech investors from Silicon Valley, Europe and Asia, we make food delivery an everyday option and build the future of eating in Asia.

Applied
Apply to dahmakan (YC S17)
Add a message to dahmakan (YC S17)
Apply

Job Description

A job that's not a job.

We don't believe in 9 to 5 work hours, meetings about meetings and casual fridays (it's pretty casual everyday). We empower you to create the startup experience that you want and give you the opportunities to challenge yourself. We expect that you walk away from this with the necessary skills and knowledge to launch your own startup.

This internship will let get your hands dirty in all parts of the business. From hustling, growth hacking, community building, business development, operations, product development, leading a team, customer care to cooking, no two days are ever the same and we like it that way. If you want to wake up knowing exactly how your day will end then this is probably not the right role for you.

And yep, we also feed you a lot of really good food (that's a given).

Compensation
$1K–$2K
No Equity

What We're Building

Eating well everyday is simple: At the push of a button, dahmakan delivers Chef-made meals straight to your door. We are 30-50% more affordable than traditional food delivery which we achieve by redefining the cost-structure of food delivery.

We combine centralised, large-scale production with customer data, machine learning and the best chefs in the industry to create an award-winning food delivery experience. Applying artificial intelligence to last mile delivery gives us the lowest delivery costs in the industry.

Funded by Y Combinator and leading tech investors from Silicon Valley, Europe and Asia, we’re conquering a trillion dollar market in the most exciting region of the world.

items.title: Growth Affiliate - get paid to spread the word!
items.content:
Are you enterprising, outgoing and resourceful? Are you looking to work in the tech sector but you're not a coder? This is a great opportunity to support the launch of our exciting new app in London this summer.

We are looking for Growth Affiliates to help spread the word and introduce us to friends, colleagues and contacts. You can work wherever suits you and put in whatever hours you can. All we ask is that you help us sign up as many active users as possible this summer.

We will pay you a commission based on the app usage of your sign-ups. Make money while you sleep - you will continue to earn this commission until the end of the year, even if you stop working well before then.

Contact us if you want first hand experience of launching and growing a mobile app, developing new business, and working with tech startup in London.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=13, c=2, mobile=7, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=67, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
MuleSoft Developer

Company: V-Soft Consulting Group, Inc
Location: Stevens Point, WI 54481
Contract

MuleSoft Developer

Primary Location – (remote) - Needs to travel to Stevens Point, WI every couple of months and paid for by the client.


V-Soft Consulting is an end-to-end recruiting and staffing solution provider known for our ability to provide highly qualified consultants for any project at any scale.


What makes us different? Our expertise is derived from over 20 years of delivering world-class IT staffing, consulting, engineering and managed services to Fortune 1000 and mid-market companies in the U.S., Canada, and Asia. V-Soft is a trusted partner with experience across diverse technology stacks to help business get IT done.


Like what you hear? Apply with V-Soft today!


V-Soft Consulting is currently hiring for a MuleSoft Developer for our premier client in Chicago, Illinois. This is a 6+month contract position in the healthcare industry.


WHAT YOU’LL NEED:

Technical Requirements and Certifications »

  • MuleSoft AnyPoint Platform or similar integration tools.
  • MuleSoft Anypoint Studio 6.4.1
  • Java JDK and JRE 1.8~
  • RAML (Restful API Modeling Language) or other design markup languages
  • Integration Technologies (XML,SOAP, HTTP, JMS, JDBC and JSON)

Desired:

  • Web API’s and or REST API’s
  • Source Control repositories (GIT, TFS)
  • Micro services architecture design
  • Build and Deployment automation tools (Apache Maven, Jenkins, etc.)
  • Experience with all aspects of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
  • Automated unit testing tools such as Microsoft Test, JUnit or other proprietary testing tools particularly Munit
  • Understanding of AWS and Virtual Private Clouds
  • Ability to read and interpret Object oriented programming languages (Java, C#, etc.)
  • Familiarity with SAP integration tool sets
  • Familiarity with Sales Force cloud-based applications
  • Experience with common ETL tools (Informatica, Talend, etc.)

Education and Experience »

  • 3+ years of systems programming/analysis experience
  • Experience analyzing and solving logical problems in mathematics and statistics
  • Experience building and changing API’s with minimum direction

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities »

  • Able to ask questions and gather information in order to create customer requested reports. Demonstrates the ability to identify problems and suggest possible causes and solutions
  • Able to review and proofread work for accuracy and completes specific aspects of assignments, as directed. Concentrates on tasks at hand, even in distracting work environments
  • Able to present information in a clear, concise, and organized manner; listen to others to obtain information
  • Able to generate new ideas and approaches to problem resolution
  • Able to function independently; resolve problems without direction
  • Able to manage own time, activities, and resources. Identify specific activities required to accomplish objectives, rank them in order of importance, and coordinate and take action to achieve desired results. Prioritize multiple activities and projects
  • Able to identify problems as they occur; follow rules, guidelines, and procedures
  • Able to interact and participate effectively in a team environment; actively listen, confront issues and provide feedback to others on the team as well as internal and external customers, in a courteous and timely manner

Interested?

Qualified candidates should send their resumes to vpondugula@vsoftconsulting.com.


V-Soft Consulting Group is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India and across the U.S., including Madison, Chicago, Denver, Harrisburg and Atlanta. Based in the Chicago office, you will be part of an agile innovative technology service company, recently recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America. V-Soft has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks, and holds such titles as MuleSoft Certified Delivery Resource, Oracle Gold Partner, ServiceNow Partner, Microsoft Partner and Cisco Registered Partner, amongst many others.

  • provided by Dice Java JDK and JRE 1.8~, MuleSoft Anypoint Studio 6.4.1, RAML, XML,SOAP, HTTP, JMS, JDBC and JSON

Experienced fundraiser at Your African Safari

Earth, Remote · Cofounder

Did you know that by 2030, Africa will be the second-largest international travel destination, after Asia? And, furthermore, the bulk of these travelers will be going to Sub-Saharan African for safari holidays.
Our aim, simply put, is to be the Trip Advisor for all things African safari. We are passionate about promoting ethical, sustainable travel and tourism and are, ourselves, admitted travel junkies.
We're multicultural, global and work and play hard. We're looking for folks who are innovative, resourceful, hard working and hard playing who want to make us the leading site for African travel. The founders have successfully worked together in the past and were part of a great exit. We want to do that again, only in an industry we're passionate about and that is untapped. Come join us!

Applied
Apply to Your African Safari
Add a message to Your African Safari
Apply

Job Description

We're ready to take our company to the next level. We've paying clients and just launched our responsive site. We've also a list of enhancements a mile long that require a cash injection to ensure we can be the first to market.
We'd love a co-founder who wants to take the helm and be our CFO and help us figure out the best way to run this ship and, even, what our options are for getting payments from Africa.
We're open to experienced people in any location and, for the right person, are willing to give a decent chunk of equity. We need to raise $500K in cash, pronto.

What We're Building

YAS is a comprehensive travel site for anyone wishing to plan an African safari—first-time safari goers and safari veteran alike. It is a one-stop resource that covers 14 African safari countries and offers valuable information and insight on the following:
The various safari parks and reserves in each country
Vaccinations needed in each country
Official languages spoken in each country
Official currencies in each country
International airports, with three-letter code, for each destination
Plug- and voltage-types required

items.title: Academic Consulting Firm Hiring Consultants
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
1.) Who we are:

We are a medium sized, cloud-based consultancy headquartered in Las Vegas, NV, USA, but with consultants spread across the globe, from Asia to South America. We primarily handle Academic Consulting for Doctorate level clients, and are currently hiring Academic Consultants.

Each position is a strictly work-from-home position, and any applicant should view this as a strong incentive. It’s vital that any potential applicant is extremely comfortable working very long hours (60+ is normal, 70 is not abnormal). The first 3 months are paid training, where pay is $3500/month. After 3 months, pay will be $3500 + bonus, where bonus will be between $0-$4000 monthly, and the expectation is the average bonus size will be $2000. The more you work, the more you get paid. It’s very normal for a successful first year consultant to make $60,000-$70,000, with these numbers reaching $80,000 by year 2.

2.) Job responsibilities for the Academic Consultant position:

The entirety of this job will be handling communications with existing and potential clients of the company, both in terms of managing existing services as well as selling new services, as well as reviewing and delivering work from independent contractors. You will you need to be able to manage expectations, and build long-lasting relationships with all of your clients. Note there is no cold calling of any kind.

3.) Requirements:

Applicants must possess a meticulous nature and an extremely high attention to detail.

Excellent command of the English Language. Native English speaker.

Post-Graduate Degree or higher, preferably from a good university.

Virtually all of our successful applicants have some background in competitive gaming (chess, poker, blackjack, etc) or have been professional academics; as such, a background of this nature is STRONGLY preferred.

All applicants must pass an UNPAID assessment, which is fairly extensive, that tests the following skillsets of any applicant.

A. Ability to review work deliverables in comparison to assignment details

B. Ability to respond properly to client requests and concerns

C. Ability to speak to clients properly by phone

D. Knowledge and background in qualitative research, ability to speak at a high academic level with clients and explain our service offerings and how it would help them with their work.

All applicants will be required to undergo the assessment before hiring decision is reached.

4.) Compensation:

All candidates, regardless of qualifications, must pass the assessment in order to be considered for the position. All candidates will receive the exact same assessment. All candidates will receive an immediate $500 signon bonus if they are onboarded for training (which is also paid at the $3500/month rate)

items.title: Business Intelligence Developer Consultant
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=6, c=2, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
Business Intelligence Developer Consultant


Iridium Technology


Job description

We currently have a development team in Prague and we are looking to expand.  The "remote" aspect is that we currently have employees working from home offices and meeting up occasionally in Prague.  This position is only open to people living in Czech and Slovak Republic.

T-SQL is one of our core technologies, and is a required skill. If you are not solid on T-SQL, please do not apply.  Our programming test for all applicants is based on T-SQL through SSMS.

The position of BI Consultant/Developer requires candidates with very strong development skills. You will be in touch with our British team, so good English is a must. We are looking for applicants who are entrepreneurial, incredibly bright, organized, focused, creative problem solvers, able to work independently, extremely hard-working, and who embrace the home office-based lifestyle.

Salary

Salary is set depending on your experience. If you can pass our application process we will be able to agree on a salary that works for you. 

Job Responsibilities

The role encompasses a combination of consulting and development duties, including: 


* You will be in close touch with our top consultants (mainly in UK) to help implement, customize and support Iridium BI products 

* Report/dashboard design and development 

* Manage client product implementations and projects to successful outcomes 

* You will also be in touch with our development team located in Prague, Czech Republic

* Design, code, deploy, and test client-specific customizations and enhancements 

* Design, code, deploy, and test Iridium BI product features and enhancements 

* Development of software tools for internal use 

* Technical investigations 

* Client support




Required Skills


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar 

* Strong development skills and experience. Our technologies are SQL Server (relational database, T-SQL, SSAS, SSRS), HTML5, Angular JS, C# and others. While we prefer experience with these technologies, we will consider developers that are familiar with other technologies - our thinking is that hard-core coders can learn any technology stack. 

* Good written/oral English 

* We develop software for law firms. Experience in Legal IT (ADERANT, Elite Enterprise, Elite 3E) is a big plus, but is not required




Life at Iridium Technology

About Iridium Technology

Does this get you excited? 
Living in Czech or Slovak Republic, getting a great salary, flexible hours, and our friendly vacation policy.  And more importantly, no commute and no parking problems, because a lot of your time will be spent working out of your home office!

Note that if you don't want to work from a home office, we will cover the cost of membership in a co-working environment (such as Impact Hub).

Work Environment

Iridium provides a great environment for developers to learn new technologies and show off their skills.  First of all, this is a company that is run by developers. 25 out of our 30 employees have degrees in Computer Science or IT.  We love to code, design architectures, streamline processes, and are relentlessly striving for constant improvement.  We have modern/relevant technology stack, and we are moving aggressively into implementing the Microsoft Azure BI/AI capabilities.  Each developer is assigned to a team with 4-5 members, and collaborative programming and collaborative problem-solving are highly encouraged. You will constantly be challenged to learn new technologies and extend your knowledge of Iridium’s products.  We offer a very agile and empowered environment – if you have a great idea, speak up and present it to the team. If the team loves your idea, then we will look for you to implement it. 

Iridium is an 8-year old company that thinks it is still a startup.  What is nice is that we have the startup attitude, but also offer stable and long-term employment with a company that has positive cash flow and is not concerned about running out of money.  We offer the start-up mindset, but without the fear that we will close our doors next month. 

If you are looking for a relaxing job where you can work 8-5 Monday through Friday, then this is not the job for you. The Iridium work experience is fast-paced and high intensity. You will be a member of a team of extremely talented and highly skilled technical employees. We all bring our “whatever it takes attitude” to solving both technical and client issues. You will be empowered to showcase your technical skills and grit on a daily basis. You will be given massive responsibility and be expected to independently manage yourself. We can promise overtime, late nights, and even some weekend work. But we can also promise a great sense of achievement, and a supportive team environment that makes it all worthwhile. Are you a hard-charger? If so, you will fit right in and you will love working here.

See more jobs at Iridium Technology

items.title: Casino or sportsbook reviewer needed for freelance work
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Casino or sportsbook reviewer needed for freelance work

Company: Team Polaris
Location: Anywhere

Job Type: Freelance

Description

We have a standing need for casino and sportsbook reviews and are looking for writers with a solid experience in any of these two domains. You are perfect for this job if you:

  • Have written multiple long-form reviews of online casinos or sportsbooks. This is a mandatory requirement; we will not consider applications from writers who are not experienced with casino or sportsbook reviews specifically. Reviews of other services or products do not count.
  • Do not shy away from research. We will provide support and access to guides and helpful resources, but you will still have to do a fair amount of research on most pieces.
  • Do not fluff and are concise. Your copy should not contain sentences that add no value to the article or which do not provide specific information about the casino or sportsbook being reviewed.
  • Are a good writer.
  • Can write objectively and without using "sales" language.

Here's an example of the type of reviews we're looking for.

If you are interested, please:

  1. Email us a link to the best casino or sportsbook review you've ever written. It should be that one review you're most proud of. Please only include a single sample and make sure it is relevant. We will not accept samples that are not either a casino review or a sportsbook review.
  2. Mention your experience reviewing sportsbook or casinos, ie. how many you've written and for how long you've been writing casino or sportsbook reviews.
  3. Mention your expected rate per 1,000 words.
  4. Please do not include a CV or cover letter.

All payments are handled via PayPal.

Thank you and looking forward to hearing from you.

items.title: Friendly Blogger in the Outdoors (Camping & Hiking) Niche
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Friendly Blogger in the Outdoors (Camping & Hiking) Niche

Company: TakeOutdoors
Location: Remote work
Job Type: Freelance

Description

How’s it going?

I’m going to have this JD with a conversational tone so you can better expect what’s it like to work for me.

I’m looking for a freelance writer who camps or hikes every now and then. To help others out there, you will be expected to compile camping/hiking related information and knowledge into entertainingly digestible articles. In the process, you can expect to gain knowledge and vastly improving your next outdoors trip. (And I’m also a fun person to work with :D)

What you should have:

  • Writing on this topic professionally for at least 3 years and is able to create articles monthly.
  • To have English as your native language and able to write in a conversational style where it'll be engaging to readers.
  • A journalist mindset, anything you write should have references or have experienced personally. Also good to seek other experts’ opinions and credit them.

Having published on similar sites such as REI, ReserveAmerica, OutsideOnline, Backpacker and KOA is an excellent plus point.

The selected candidate would be expected to perform the following:

  • Do research (Yes because I don’t like #fakenews ;), you will be expected to provide references. Of course, personal experience is good as well)
  • Write at least 1 long article per month on my outdoors blog. (To make your life easier, I can provide the topics and outlines. I would be delighted if you can give suggestions!).
  • Occasionally helping out with other website content.

Does this sound interesting to you? If it does, I look forward to you sharing the following items for my consideration of your application to this role:

  1. Your CV, blog, portfolio
  2. Links to your published articles or any other similar content.
  3. Your expected rates
  4. Your weekly availability
  5. (Optional but big plus) Proof of your outdoor enthusiasm, share a photo of yourself in the outdoors! Camping or hiking preferably.

In the subject of your email, indicate “Take me in or regret!”.  Apparently, there is no subject field in the application.

In the first line of your application, indicate “I enjoyed reading your job description and I want to try it out. You may regret not hiring me!”.

So what are you waiting for?

items.title: Human Resources Coordinator
items.content:
Human Resources Coordinator


Empire Flippers

 verified
We are looking to bring on an HR Coordinator to join our team in Saigon, Vietnam on September 12, 2018, where you’ll start your training during our quarterly meetup.
Our company has grown significantly in the last year. You only need to look at our public quarterly reports to see the massive growth our company has achieved. We’ve been on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing American companies twice now! In 2016, we came in at 161, and last year, we came in at 172.
And we’re just getting started!
You will play a pivotal role in helping us grow, organize and vet future hires for the company. As the HR Coordinator you will be performing background checks on our potential employees, review and revise our hiring emails, update and maintain our career boards and other tasks associated with hiring new talent for the company.
You will spend the first 4-6 months with us in SE Asia training with our management team. This position has the potential to become location-independent once your training is done and you can expect some travel. (SE Asia, Europe, US, etc.) You will be in a probationary period for the first six months, and afterwards we’ll have you up and running as an HR Coordinator.
You should either be a digital nomad or interested in the digital nomad lifestyle. This is very important for this role, since our entire company is remote and our people are regularly on the move. We would need you to be knowledgeable about the unique challenges that comes with managing such a remote team so you can best serve them.
Ideally, we would want you to be based primarily out of SE Asia since so much of our team tends to live in this part of the world. This would allow you to meet face to face with the team fairly regularly and also travel to several events we do around the region every year.

See more jobs at Empire Flippers

Visit Empire Flippers's website

items.content:
About Monese


At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody. The first Monese product already serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.


Our fast growing team is located in London, United Kingdom and Tallinn, Estonia, and we know that what we’re building is bigger than anything on the market today. Join us!


About the role


We are looking for a responsible Personal Assistant to provide personalised secretarial and administrative support in a well-organised and timely manner. You will work on a one-to-one basis on a variety of tasks related to our CEO’s and Company Director’s working life and communication.


Your day-to-day tasks will include, but are not limited to:


* Organising and assisting the CEO as well as the Company Director
* Act as the point of contact between the CEO/Director and internal/external parties
* Handle requests and queries appropriately
* Manage diary, schedule meetings and appointments as well as make travel arrangements
* Format information for internal and external communication – memos, emails, presentations, reports
* Completing ad hoc tasks as required

REQUIREMENTS

As a perfect candidate you should bring with you:

* Proven work experience as a personal assistant
* Excellent English skills
* Very good written and verbal communication skills
* Good time management and prioritisation skills
* Excellent organisational skills
* Great attention to detail
* Efficacy, patience and positive attitude


Benefits of working at Monese:


* Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
* A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
* International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks
* Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
* Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
* In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities
* Flexible working schedule and possibility to work remotely
* Stock options and competitive salary

Sounds like something for you?


Then please send us your CV and cover letter. And be quick to apply, as we will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately.

Petal | New York City | Full-Time | ONSITE or REMOTE

Petal is a credit card accessible to people without a credit history, by using machine learning to analyze someone's cash flow instead of the traditional credit score-based model. Our aim is to serve the 65 million people in the U.S. (many immigrants, young people, and minorities) shut out of financial services.

Shipping a world-class product across web, iOS, and Android is core to our mission and operating philosophy, and UI engineering quality is paramount. We have two roles open on the UI engineering team, to work on our React/React Native applications. We using Redux for state management, styled-components for styling, a bunch of Node scripts for building a cross-platform web/native app (using Expo), are open sourcing some ESlint plugins we've written, and have some really cool Node / GraphQL projects in the works.

items.title: Full-time, remote within US, UK, France Ksplice is a key technology in Oracle's Linux offering and powers our engineered ...
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=18, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Full-time, remote within US, UK, France

Ksplice is a key technology in Oracle's Linux offering and powers our engineered systems and public cloud, patching the Linux kernel, user-space and virtualization stack without any downtime. We're a distributed team of engineers forming part of the Linux and Virtualization group at Oracle with a passion for working on exciting technology, software craftmanship and all things Linux.

We're looking for a systems engineer to help scale as we continue to expand into the Linux stack, developing custom tooling and automation for patching thousands of kernels, hypervisors and packages to rapidly respond to security updates. This is a varied role that will see you building Python based tools to manage large numbers of virtual machines, writing C based patching and analysis tools and debugging hard problems in a variety of Linux distributions.

Required skills include:

  * Experience building complex systems in Python or other systems languages.  * Strong understanding of low-level programming in C/C++ and associated tooling.  * Experience of Linux virtualization solutions including KVM/libvirt+Xen.
Other useful skills include:

  * Experience developing the Linux kernel or other low-level applications.  * Performance tuning and optimization.  * Excellent problem solving and debugging skills.  * Familiarity with configuration managment tools such as Puppet/Chef/Ansible.  * Experience in developing cloud native solutions.
More information about Ksplice is available at http://ksplice.oracle.com/ and you can contact me by email at jamie.iles@oracle.com if you have any questions. Oracle is an equal opportunity employer.

items.content:
NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED - THIS IS FOR ANYBODY AND EVERYBODY

YOU CAN BE BASED ANYWHERE IN THE UK

MarkStrat UK is a Customer Experience Management Company. We offer clients of all shapes and sizes mystery shopping programs, across their multiple locations, to ensure all locations are delivering on the brand promise and customer service values.

We need as many mystery shoppers to sign up, and we will send you notifications of jobs in your area. You can do as many or as little mystery shop jobs as you want. Each one is given on a first come first served basis.

For each 'job' (mystery shop visit), you will be paid the expenses of the visit, in exchange for a short written report on your experiences.

This is a great way to experience new things, get free meals, and visit events/ services you might not otherwise be able to.

A great position to do in your spare time, at weekends, or as a side hobby with your studies.

Apply to this advert and I will send you the link to register.
